original_data.question: An 18-year-old male presents to the emergency department trauma bay with a gunshot wound to the abdomen. The patient undergoes an exploratory laparotomy, during which, it is discovered that his splenic artery was damaged at its origin from the celiac trunk. The surgeon ligates the splenic artery at its origin. Which of the following arteries will now be hypoperfused as a result?

model_response:
The splenic artery arises from the celiac trunk, which also gives rise to the left gastric artery. The splenic artery then gives rise to the branches listed in the answer choices. Therefore, if the splenic artery is ligated at its origin, all of these branches will be hypoperfused.

Answer: OPTION A IS CORRECT.</s><s>

question_entities.definition: A person who belongs to the sex that normally produces sperm. The term is used to indicate biological sex distinctions, cultural gender role distinctions, or both.
Hospital department responsible for the administration and provision of immediate medical or surgical care to the emergency patient.
Damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity.
Disruption of structural continuity of the body as a result of the discharge of firearms.
bodily injury caused by physical means, with disruption of the normal continuity of structures.
That portion of the body that lies between the THORAX and the PELVIS.
Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures.
Surgical examination of the contents of the abdominal cavity as a means of diagnosis.
The largest branch of the celiac trunk with distribution to the spleen, pancreas, stomach and greater omentum.
Physical harm reducing the value, operation, or usefulness of something.
System of classification based on nation from which a person originates, regardless of the nation in which he/she currently resides.
The arterial trunk that arises from the abdominal aorta and after a short course divides into the left gastric, common hepatic and splenic arteries.

The largest branch of the celiac trunk with distribution to the spleen, pancreas, stomach and greater omentum.
System of classification based on nation from which a person originates, regardless of the nation in which he/she currently resides.
The vessels carrying blood away from the heart.
No component of the tumor exhibits perfusion equal to or greater than cerebellar gray matter, excluding encased or grossly visible intrinsic vasculature.
